events.description: The release of retail trade data for the Eurozone for the month of December 2025.

facts.fact_text: Eurozone retail sales fell by 0.5% month on month in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Eurozone retail sales fell by 0.5% month on month in December 2025

facts.fact_text: Non-food retailing sales dropped 1.2% in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The weakness was led by non-food retailing, where sales dropped 1.2%

facts.fact_text: Retail activity contracted in France (-1.4%), Spain (-0.9%), and Italy (-0.5%), while Germany rose 0.1%.

evidences.evidence_text: retail activity contracted notably in France (-1.4%), Spain (-0.9%) and Italy (-0.5%), while Germany recorded a modest increase of 0.1%

facts.fact_text: Annual retail sales growth slowed to 1.3% in December.

evidences.evidence_text: On an annual basis, retail sales growth slowed sharply to 1.3% in December

claims.claim_text: The retail sales data undershot market expectations.

evidences.evidence_text: undershooting market expectations for a 0.2% decline

claims.claim_text: The Eurozone is experiencing a loss of consumer momentum toward the end of the year.

evidences.evidence_text: underscoring a loss of consumer momentum toward year-end

evidence.evidence_text: underscoring a loss of consumer momentum toward year-end
The weakness was led by non-food retailing, where sales dropped 1.2%
